review: TGI...You make my hormones go crazyyy! I guess from my previous review, it was just an "off" day for TGIF.  We came here recently, and had a good time.  Had a GREAT server after only waiting for 10 minutes. I have to find out what him name was buy I do know that t started with an 'E'. We didn't get treated poorly so that's always a plus. Food was good a always, especially their Jack Daniels sauce... YUM! Til we meet again TGI
Great chicken sandwiches. Good customer service.

we dined there about two weeks ago, taking advantage of their dinner special menu. we ordered the steak on the special dinner menu, but the server brought us a bigger sized-steak.  To our surprise, when the check arrive, our bill was $20.00 more than expected.  when I point out this error to our server, he seemed he did not care, stating that it is the correct bill.  Only when I brought this matter to the manager's attention, then the error was correct.  Food was decent for a chain restaurant, thumbs up to the manager and down to our server.

My friend and I came in for a quick bite to eat because the wait at Wildberry was over an hour.  We should've waited.... We were the first people in the restaurant, which was kind of weird.  The bartender was our server.  I ordered a water with a lemon, my friend an Iced tea.  When the drinks came out, the tea was about as light in color as my water.  She asked for a diet coke instead and he brought her a different iced tea that was ok....he was also very creepy.... We ordered two salads, I had the Yucatan Chicken Salad, which is great, and she got the Pecan Crusted Chicken Salad, which was equally delicious.  We would have loved to enjoy our lunch, and our conversation, but it was almost impossible as this guy WOULD NOT leave us alone to eat!  He kept walking by our table, butting in to our conversation and was just overall ruining our afternoon.  We could not get out of there quick enough, we asked for the check, paid and split!  I will probably not go back on a Saturday afternoon again, just in fear of having to deal with this bartender!!  Food was great, Service...two thumbs down!

Came here during the day with family. Too many stipulations for the lunch menu. Server messed up a our order, wouldn't take steps to correct it. Wouldn't admit she made a mistake. Put hot plates in front of kids. Disappointing service. Won't come back.

Our server was friendly. He kept pressuring me to buy a drink, but I guess that's something he is required to do. Every time I do give in and get one its never really all that great.  2 for 10 deal is pretty awesome.  Get the steak tacos. Yum!

Ignored our table and even after we finally got a waitress she took are order and didn't enter it in the computer or bring us our drinks she closed out 2 tables and then chatted with customers. We finally left and the manager did nothing about the service.

This place is TERRIBLE!!  I ordered french onion soup, it looked like the bread and cheese on it was frozen and they put it in the microwave.  The cheese was white and it was boiling hot.  Also ordered the small garlic fried shrimp.  It was so greasy, I used one napkin for every shrimp to absorb the grease.  Never, never, never again.  Hire a cook!

Pins galore, this place reminds me of Office Space. The fake smiles, the fake voices that sound almost insulting and definitely makes me want to punch the waiter. But then I remember that behind that corporate brainwashed facade, there is a human being that is trying to make money and survive.  What is up with the pressure, buy appetizers, buy drinks, you need more drinks. I get it, you get paid off of it and there are probably contests each restaurant runs but back off buddy. I feel like they are pedaling crack and cocaine. I am going to spend MY money on what I want, not what You want. Ok, rant done. Food is greasy and so chainy. I only came here to meet a friend to grab shoes I had lent her. I got the spinach dip and the jack daniels chicken and shrimp combo. They cheated me on both. I could have eaten all of the dip with three chips. The chicken was small and dried out. My drink was all ice and no booze. Meanies.
They can do better with the service! It is terrible! Food was alright
Bad food, they only fill your bar drinks half way not what you pay for, and the service is TERRIBLE.  Don't come here if you're looking for a quality restaurant.

My husband and I have been to this location twice and we enjoyed our meal and experience both times! On the second visit my husband ordered the jack Daniels burger but didn't like it, the waitress was quick to replace his order with a regular burger and the manger even came over to make sure everything was to our satisfaction! We both really appreciated the service we received! Would go there again when in the area!

TGI Fridays has come a long way from the days of red stripes and "flare buttons."  2 for $10 deal might just be the best thing out there amongst mid tier trendy restaurant chains. Forget the 2 for $20/25/30 deals because this deal allows each individual person to get their own appetizer and entrée.  We chose the BBQ Chicken Flatbread, Spicy White Cheddar Queso Dip, and both ordered the Jack Daniel's Burger for an entrée. $20 bought you a lot more food than expected - we had to take two boxes home.  In addition to the 2 for $10 deal, TGI Fridays also has a daily special like half off appetizers and $6 burgers. With these promotions, TGI Fridays is doing a great job of stepping up their game by offering options for the casual diner to family get-togethers. With an all new branding campaign reflecting pop culture throughout American history and a new menu, it's back to thank goodness its Friday.
although the food was great i'm giving 2* just for inconsistency. as a reward member they all give u free chips and salsa. well not this time. did u guys cut that back or?

Saw Jack Daniels commercial and the food LOOKED good.....ordered the appetizer plate because it didn't come with "seasoned fries"....seriously ? You think fries need to be seasoned? So after what seems like close to an eternity the "food" comes. The Chicken nugget like pieces were the redemption (barely) for the barely breaded greasy /oily overcooked rubber shrimp and the  "we don't take off the membrane from the ribs"...wait what? You don't take off that inner skin on the ribs? So I had to do it to make it edible. The ribs were tender but had a weird spice combination and no BBQ sauce. I'm guessing they feel you will use the Jack Sauce which is a far better name for it....stopped using that after the 2nd shrimp....would have begged for some BBQ sauce if I could find where the waiter was hiding....a better choice would be chicken nuggets, fish bites and a McRib @ McDonalds....this place is way over rated....

Now that I've grown up a little bit, I try to avoid chains and franchises as much as realistically possible.  That said, my +1 and I were in the area for a festival, had had a late lunch, and were craving a little something to nosh on.  He suggested Friday's, so I obliged. We were seated promptly (Saturday night) and our server was attentive - giving us time to peruse the menu. (We have a tendency to talk too much and not look at the menus right away.)  He always brought drink refills - always before we had even polished off the last of our drinks.  Awe-some!  I wish I remembered his name!  He was a Hispanic guy, perhaps in his 40s. We ordered two appetizers to share:  the BBQ Chicken Flatbread and the Warm Pretzels with Beer-Cheese Dipping Sauce.  I hate to admit it, but the Pretzels were REALLY good: warm, mushy, and lightly salted.  The Beer-Cheese didn't have any beer taste..it just tasted like a light cheese to me, but it was alright.  The Flatbread was OK - pretty light.  I'm glad it didn't have much cheese.  Overall it was a pretty good Friday's experience. :)

Chain restaurant at its finest. If you go in accepting that, you'll be fine. If not, you will be very disappointed.  I came here with the SO, and we both got the 2 for $10 deal: crispy green beans, and chicken tenders with honey mustard. The food came out quickly, hot, and fresh. And it was a TON of food, neither of us could finish it all. And our server was very cool.  I'm not huge on chain restaurants, and TGI Friday's isn't my number one choice. But I'd probably come again.

I had a good experience here today with my friend for a late lunch. I thought my beer was super cheap! it was $5? and some change. I got a guiness and angry orchard. or was that woodchuck on the bottom? I don't know. The broccolli and cheddar soup I had was yummy. My friend seemed to have enjoyed her food. Nothing to complain about. My meal altogether was $19? Pretty pricy... I'd say go with a special or deals that they're having. Overall customer service is great here. I like this place. If I'm hungry and in the area yeah I'll  be back.

First time here and the service was kinda slow, but the waitress and food was really good. TGIF has always been good across the board and this wasn't any different. It can get really busy in this area and so it's best to go during no peak hours and days to avoid traffic and slower service.

Everything with JACK DANIELS sauce is AMAZING! Besides that, I really don't suggest getting a steak here because they never get it right. TGI Fridays is more for burgers, appetizers and desserts. One thing that bothered me, was when I ordered chips and Guacamole, I literally received 1tablespoon of guacamole with lots of red onions. I didn't complain but i think there's a guacamole shortage here. Besides that, our orders came in a timely manner and the food was nothing special except for the JACK DANIELS SAUCE
Great food , good prices , friendly staff , and good for family ,  fine deserts

Went on a Sunday afternoon, all of the workers looked miserable. Our waitresd was inattentive, nearly knocked one of my party members phones out of his hand reaching across the table. Food seemed old or had been sitting for some time, def won't be coming back.

I would give this location a zero star.  Service is horrible, unfriendly and rude.  Food is greasy or dried out.  Food takes forever to come.  I had such bad service one night and did not leave a tip.  The server followed me outside yelling at me.  I went back in and got the manager.  While waiting the kid told me f' you.   He got fired but not a great experience.  I decided to give it one last try last week.  The host was not friendly, did not smile and when I requested a booth by a window he made a big deal of it.  The place was empty. I have complained a few times to the manager there.  Its not worth going.  Im done with fridays.  Seeing many of the other bad reviews hopefully they get new management or close down.

Went here after a graduation the other day to celebrate and let me tell you, we will likely not be returning.  First off, it took too long to be seated but I get it that we had a larger group and they were busy so this is not the main reason for the bad review.  However, if they took reservations, that would be a plus.  But they don't.   On to dinner....took 10 minutes alone to get a waitress to come over and greet us after we sat down.  From initial sit down to leaving it took 3 hours to get in and out of the restaurant.....Far too long!!!  I ordered the Jack Daniels burger and had asked for medium.  Instead they served it extremely well don't, charred and tasteless.  They serve some craft beers which is a small plus but the selection is not overwhelming.  Overall, not a good experience at all and we will not be returning.
Food was good. But super cold inside LOL. Service was good as well. Price was okay. But definitely going back there sometime soon

Unfriendly welcome into a cold atmosphere, literally and figuratively, when asked to be seated at a booth by the window the hostess' response was those are dirty. How much effort does it take to clean the table??  I also would have been willing to wait for them to clean the table, but apparently that was not an option. We were seated towards the back of the restaurant that is very poorly lit. I was snooping through their drink menu and it smelled like barf with stains on it.  Ordered my steak medium rare and it came back medium-well. Asked for the manager and they offered to replace it with a new one (I don't believe in wasting food so I refused). Not only was the steak bad, but the mashed potatoes were very bland. Tasted even worse than something could come out of the box. Mac and Cheese had a burnt buttered noodle. Hardly any cheese and they use penne rigate as their pasta. After we called the manager to the table to let her know about the food, the waitress became very hostile and upset at us as she would make as little contact as she could with us. There is a sign on the door that advertises free WiFi. As I tried to login to it, their website failed to work. I asked the waitress why it might not be working and she simply just shrugged her shoulders.  As soon as I finished my meal I still felt hungry, for the amount of money I spent there I would much rather have gone 20 miles to Crystal Lake and dined at Texas Road house and received proper service and food.  After this experience I will never dine here again.

We sat in the bar and watched as other people came in after us; as they were waited on and their drinks were served, we were told, "I'll be right with you" by our server. Then another couple was seated, waited on and served by our server. We then proceeded to the door and asked for the manager ... who then took our order (comp'ing our appetizer). Our food was eventually served, by yet a third worker. No one ever check on us, asked how our food was, or if we needed anything else. Our drinks ran dry (both our water and bar drinks) and we had to ask twice for the check. Service was horrible.  Food was tasty. Good luck. I hope your experience is better than ours.
Julie was our server and she was awesome! I Always like to go to fridays for some drinks and appetizers. Food was good and service was excellent. Way to go Julie!! Try the Barbados rum punch!

Everything was disappointing my steak tasted like it was frozen and thrown on the grill it was chewie I chewed and chewed and chewed and ended up spitting it out ... The jack Daniel chicken was fine the portion was very small not worth the penny  me b my husband crossed this place out of our list forever

I love TGIFridays but this place needs some help in the waiting category.  I've been to many TGIFriday locations in the past but seems like this one falls short in service. Due to the  food selection, we now know that if we are going to eat here, we plan to come much earlier to avoid any lunch rush. Jack Daniels menu is always one of my favorites.  From the steaks to ribs and burgers, you can't go wrong with the Jack Daniels menu.

I feel like you know what your getting, food quality wise when you go to TGI Friday's and this location does an amazing job.  I took my mom here for Mother's Day and we ordered a bottle of wine, they were half off!  If you don't finish the bottle you can take it home with you.  For the value this is great because it ends up being cheaper for two people to drink than ordering separate glasses.  I am also part of their email club and they send out great coupons to use from time to time.   I highly reccomend signing up for those!

Service is fast, I haven't seen that speed never ever before. Fast is not good always. We went for a family dinner last night, ordered Mac n cheese for the kids, came in less than 3 mins, top layer was warm, rest of the food in the bowl was room temperature to mildly cold. I really care a big deal about my kids and disappointed. I didn't complain to mgmgt as I didn't want to ruin our evening with complaints and apologies and refund may be. I told my kids that its our first time here and we will never ever come back again. Rest of our food was similar rushed out quickly reheated, half over heated and partly warm. I didn't expect this from this place.

I had the Cajun chicken and shrimp and it was delicious and filling. My friend had the shrimp and chicken pasta and I tried it was so good. It was seasoned so well. Nice and clean good ambiance and we didn't have to wait. I tried the ultimate blueberry-Lol long island ice tea and you can definitely taste the alcohol was very delicious.

I'm very picky about my ribs: I like mine with my fiancé's special dry rub, grilled real low and slow. There's nothing more mediocre and unimpressive to me than a plate of greasy ribs smothered in a generic tasting BBQ sauce at a restaurant. But, I was pleasantly surprised when I actually enjoyed the baby back ribs at TGI Friday's!! The Jack Daniel's ones to be exact!! There's something smoky hiding underneath that intensely sweet, annoyingly sticky Jack Daniel's sauce... And my taste buds love it!Way to go Friday's!
Sat in bar area. Bartender (male) was so rude and not helping us at all. Food was awesome. Too bad about service.
Food was great but service lacked. Communication with our server was not clear. His English is not the best. But I very pleased with the food.

Great service. ( Daytona dj ) But the food was ehh. Not impressed at all. And way too expensive for the quality of the food. The sangria was good. But for $11.09 no thank you. Will NOT be coming back for a while. Let down. I'm not sure when they changed but for me it's a bad change. Sorry no thanks.

This place was decent, it was close to the hotel. I tried the French dip with the side salad. It was really good. It had a soft bun which was great for dipping in the ua jus. If your trying to figure out a certain taste about it, it's the horseradish. The salad was light and refreshing. Good place for a quick decent meal at a good price.

I have not gone to TGI Friday's for a few years now. I reluctantly went with my husband and the kids and was pleasantly surprised.  Even though it was a little crowded we were seated right a way and multiple servers tended to our needs. The food was great and loved the healthy options. Will definitely come back again.

I came here to try the Jack Daniel's Burger and it was amazing!!!  It has everything on it including Bacon and it's huge!  They give you a Jack Daniel's dipping sauce on the side and it comes with a big batch of fries.  I like that they have that daily drink special at an honestly good price.  I had the apple martini and it was the perfect combination.  We went during the middle of the week and it was very packed.  The waiter was attentive, friendly and efficient.  It's a pretty loud and busy atmosphere.  They also have a bar right in the middle if you just want to drink and watch sports.  Very good prices and very good food. We came back again for the Jack Daniel's Chicken and Breaded Shrimp and the Salted Caramel cake with ice-cream. So delicious...

I got to say the food here is great! Very reasonable food and drink prices. The garlic parmesan fries are a must try! The steak was good too. The long island's are strong and taste good for only $4. The appetizers we got was only $5 each. This is a great location. Friendly staff.  Our waitress mellissa was awesome. Very attentive even on a busy Friday night and very professional and friendly.

We had dinner her on Sat night.  We arrived at 8pm after some shopping in the area.  We had a 20 minute wait which we sat at the bar and had some drinks.  We sat and spoke with the bartenders which were very good at handling the full bar and still finding time to converse with customers.  When we got our table our waiter was very nice and respectable he was prompt on the food and getting our drinks.   I got a Jack Daniels burger which was a little messy but other than that a good meal.

The quality of food is way below the price point they charge.  I've only gotten carry out, so I can't speak about the service, other than to say that the orders are always correct for take away.  The salads are fresh.  It's just way overpriced.  Spend the same elsewhere and have a much better experience.

I will start off with customer service is pretty good. They are friendly and they seem to be on top of things when they make a mistake. My husband and I went here last night and ordered some appetizers, a couple drinks as well as I ordered soup and my husband ordered a burger. The waitress must have forgotten our appetizer because we got the soup and burger first. We mentioned it to another waitress who was fast to resolve the issue. The manager came to our table to apologize and got a bunch of apologies all around. Honestly, it wasn't even a big deal for us. They didn't even charge us for our appetizers which was nice of them but again we didn't mind the slip up, it happens. What I didn't care for was the food and my drink. My drink was too cloyingly sweet with hardly any vodka in it. The French onion soup was super salty. The potato skins were dry and kind of burnt from sitting in hot oil and my husbands burger must have originated from a frozen patty because it was leaking water. The only good food was the fried green beans which surprisingly the green bean tasted fresh. I suppose that is what we get from going to a chain restaurant.

Review Update: TGIF is a GREAT place to meet up with friends or family!! My sister and I were there last week and had a GREAT server!!! We had the Loaded Potatoes as an appetizer, Two Classic Cheeseburgers as our meals, and the CREAMY & DELICIOUS Vanilla Bean Cheesecake!!! Probably one of the best we've ever had!!! Better than any other!! We'll be back for more GREAT food TGIF!!

Came in for lunch break because I was craving a jack daniels burger-my usual order when I come to this restaurant. When I got my plate I got a very small portion of fries compared to what I've usually seen. Also my burger wasn't good or appetizing. The meat was very dry and tasted weird.

We always have a great time when we visit here. Love the drinks, they carry crown apple if anyone else cares. Staff is always courteous and welcoming, food is what it is. I have been going here for many years and today I would like to suggest a diaper changing station in the men's room. You guys have the wall space, make if happen!  Cheers
This place sucks. Their food as all other Fridays is terrible and it's dirty and disgusting. The kitchen microwaves most of its food and the presentation sucks. Will never eat at a Fridays again

Went for a quick team lunch outing.   I always appreciate restaurants that act as if they realize people may be coming during their lunch hour and ensures they are attended to immediately, which was the case here.   We were seated immediately and ordered our food within 5 minutes of arrival.  The food arrived pretty fast and actually tasted great, but what happened to the waitress after the food came?! I ordered the new  SICILIAN STACKED BURGER, and so did one of my co-workers.  It was good, but a little overwhelming after I kept at it.  It was stacked with so much.  By the end I had picked it apart and was eating just what I wanted.   My co-worker ordered some type of salad that was supposed to have apricots and kale in it.. we never located either but she said the salad was good despite it.   Another of my co-workers ordered a cajun pasta which was fell in love with.   For some reason the waitress never came back to check on us, which was an issue because we had received the wrong drinks.   Nevertheless, we settled for what we had.  I wouldnt say that was a game breaker which is why i was still able to give it 4 stars.  (I would say that is why here tip was not as large as it could have been.) I will be back!

This is the best Friday's we've ever been to. The food is always cooked to perfection and served quickly. The staff is always helpful and willing to go the extra mile without being overbearing. We go to this location all the time, and receive 5-star treatment every time. When you stop in, be sure to request Axl as your server! He's incredibly observant (brings refills when you're actually thinking about asking for one), he checks in often (but not so often as to be bothersome), and makes great suggestions (for dessert or drinks or apps). We spoke to the manager about how great he was, and the manager told us he was one of the newer servers at this location. We couldn't believe it, they must have a good training process (or good luck to have found Axel!).  We will be back soon, and often!
Worst service ever! Our drinks sat on the bar for 10 minutes before getting to us every single time. The bar wasn't full yet we had to wait for ever for our drinks. We will NOT be coming back.

Don't go here. Slow service and crappy food. I used to come here when they do endless apps just to try the new apps. Each time they do it, it gets worse and worse.  The service was so slow even with an almost empty restaurant. After we ordered the app, it took forever and every new time we got our apps, it got saltier and saltier. They are skimpy on the meat too. Basically they want you to get full on the carbs (bread, tostada, wonton skins, etc). The potstickers had very little filling. The "new" tostadas were mostly some weird salty, sweet white sauce and wilted cilantro. There was barely any braised bbq beef. Like a tiny piece on each. My flatbread barely had chicken on it... mostly bread. The last time I ordered the flatbread, there was NO chicken. I mean, they barely put chicken as it is.... but still! This used to be one of the best endless apps, but they ruined it! I brought it to attention from my server but he just apologized. He didn't offer to fix it or anything. All he did was ask if we wanted to order dessert... Nice. I'm pretty sure the manager brought us our flatbread and I'm sure he could see there was no chicken but he still brought it. Idk what that says about the service there. You can tell the servers don't want you to order more. They act like it! They weren't like that before.. idk what happened. So disappointing because their endless apps used to be good! It's only $12/person but I still feel like I was ripped off. It used to be $10/person and they raised the price. That's understandable, but what isn't is the quality of the food and service getting worse and worse. I most definitely will not be coming back and I hope you don't either. Save your money and your appetite.

My friend and I went here the other day bc she is a rewards member and had enough points for a free meal, which is why we picked it in the first place.  She got the steak sizzler w spinach and mashed potatoes . I ordered the turkey burger w broccoli instead of fries and we shared a pick three app.  At first the service was a but slow but we were chatting and in no hurry so we didnt mind. The app was great. Their pretzels and cheese, boneless wings and pot stickers are always very good. Their potato skins are very crispy and over fried , lots of oil coming from them. Our meals came and i cut into my turkey burger and took a bite, it was so dry yet juicy in the middle. It wasnt too hot either so it might have been sitting waiting for my friends steak to be done. I told our waitress and she took it back and got me a new one, i asked for cheese this time hoping it would help. The new one was great and not dry at all. She came and checked back to make sure all was ok and it was. My friend gave her info for the free meal and when she cane back she let us know that she took my turkey burger off the bill bc i had to wait for the new one . That is great customer service and she didnt have to do that. She got a bigger tip bc of it too and I let her know I would be letting Yelp know who to see when they to to TGIF in Schaumburg . Her name is Alicia , there was a survey in the bottom of our receipt to fill out for a free app next time we came in but i didnt know we only had 48 hrs to fill it out so it expired already . But I will call there and let them know how nice Alicia was and it was cool she took my burger off without me even saying anything. Which i didnt plan on bc we already got one meal free anyway.

I don't go to Fridays a lot, but this was definitely the worst experience ever. Our neighbor table was complaining about the service, so that should've been a red flag.  I ordered a classic cheeseburger, medium well and even said "more well than medium". I noticed the server didn't write down neither how I or my boyfriend ordered the cooking type of our burgers, but I figured he would tell the cook. We also mentioned how we needed to eat quickly because we had to be somewhere. The food comes and my burger is SO PINK in the middle, almost rare. I was really upset. We didn't have time to complain and wait for another one, like I said we had to leave to be somewhere. I was starving so I just sucked it up. But it's unacceptable to me that he didn't listen to that simple request. I didn't ask for my mediocre cheeseburger to be served in a golden platter, I just wanted it cooked medium well. I also find it extremely unprofessional when you go to a restaurant that serves meat and they don't even ask you how you want it cooked. I will most likely not return to this Schaumburg location. Extremely disappointed.

I went here with a bunch of friends to have a nice meal and discuss the political motives behind law enforcement, as well as the strategic use of squad car positioning to effectively ticket dangerous motorists! I was wholeheartedly let down when our waitress told us she wasn't going to fill up our drinks every fifteen minutes. Fifteen minutes is a substantial as well as appropriate amount of time to finish a Dr Pepper. This act of pure communism has not and will not go unnoticed. I recommend that unless you voted for Stalin last election you don't attend this disgraceful establishment. Not to mention the Jack Daniels burger tasted more like the whisky bottle than meat. Worst service ever...-100 out of 5

I actually love this place. All the food is great, and they have a lot of really yummy non-alcoholic drinks. The staff is very nice and helpful, I've never had a bad experience here. I also just called to see if I could get rewards points applied to my account since I forgot about it while I was there the other day and I didn't have the stripes code to add them myself, and the manager told me he would just add the points that I earned! So great! I thought that was super awesome of him so I will definitely go back!
The usual American (food) food but we expected that. Great coctails, good prices and excellent service from the bartenders!!!! Good job

Went with a couple friends. The server was very friendly and nice and the food came out very fast. The food was great and overall a really good experience. Highly recommend this place and its mozzarella sticks.

If you hate yourself and hate good service this is the place for you! Made a mistake of coming here tonight (6/21) with family from out of town.  Idk why but I thought we could get a decent bite and service! Wrong, wrong!! Both those things turned out not true! The service terrible.. So bad that the manager had to come take our order after our waitress apparently insisted we order 2 mins after we sat down by looking over us while we wanted to gaze at the menu! Like do we have to order when you insist? So politely asked her to give us a couple mins... We were literally ready to order within 5 mins and lo and behold 20 mins of waiting later my mother had to ask for the manager so we could place an order for drinks!  The manager comes by apologizes and offers us free dessert! Okay, that's fair! We proceed to order and the waitres comes with oue drinks fairly quickly! Kudos to her. A sip into my drink and i notice a finger print (out of flour) on my wine glass! TF... Are you shitting me? You can't care to wash down a wine glass? I bring it to the waitresses notice, she mumbles some half assed apology and goes on to get me another glass.. Okay cool, I guess I can deal with this. We wait for our food and a couple mins later we get our order... Not bad I think things are looking up! Wrong, Wrong! Things are about to get worse, my friend! I get the pick 3 apps(boneless wings, friend green beans and LOADED potatoes) as my entree. I've spelt LOADED with caps because the only thing they were loaded with was burnt cheese. No bacons, no chives nothing.  It's like at this point they didn't even care! I went with my meal made sure my fam enjoyed their meal and before I left I brought it to the waitresses attention. Again, she could care less asked if we needed a box! Haha a box for what? Even a homeless person wouldn't want this garbage!  With that and $82 later... I have decided that even white castle and I truly despise everything about white castle is better than this! I've even tweeted at TGIF but I can guarantee they don't give a f*** because we got your $82!!  Haha anyways all in all I rate them with a 0 P.S: This was a quiet Tuesday night with 7 tables occupied! Really quiet to get shitty service tbh!

Cool place to have a drink happy hour or late night, It's never really crowded now here's the thing about Friday's the food is mediocre at best but drink specials and afterwork apps and drinks it's perfect... Today was the day I met a awesome server (Paige from THE "618") is Excellent she was very professional and Friendly she has a great southern personality and was very accommodating overall.....nice place overall check it out  Nothing big would have been 4 stars but the salad dressing is weak!!!

So I decide to do something spontaneous  and go to TGI for a meal, I order the lame as surf and Turf, and a Apple Martini, when the waitress took my order I told her to bring the martini with my meal and sure enough, she brought it before my meal, also with the surf & Turf I wanted spinach mac and cheese as my sides, she brought me mashed potatoes and broccoli, I asked the steak to be cook med/rare she brought it to me Well over cooked and hard to chew, I ask could I use a coupon but she says No because my meal was on a special, personally I think she should have taken the coupon since my service sucked the whole time I was there, and then to top it off I asked her to give me check so I gave her my Credit card ,she came back with the receipt and no Credit card , so I had to find her to get my Credit card back, The Food and Service Sucked ASS, and I left no tip! and It will be a longtime or Never before I go back there again, so very Disappointed!

Worst service I've ever had at any restaurant. The food was okay. But our waiter, Ricardo, did not even check on us until after we finished our meal. Also, it took him 20 plus minutes to bring us a check and another 10 min to pick it up. Terrible. Will not be returning here.

Had awesome service! Natalie did a great job introducing all the specials. Also, the manager did a great job going around asking about service. He was also helping all the servers deliver food. As a customer, I felt a good vibe just watching him help his employees.  Check number was 1239

First off let me say I was just happy they're open on Thanksgiving night. I appreciate that they also have families so they would like to be with and it was nice meeting up and go somewhere to eat on the holiday. The service was top-notch can't say enough about it. From the host to the bartender and to a waitress everyone was very nice polite. But once once last call came everybody was in hyper mode to hurry up and get out there as quick as possible. I got the 3 apps for like 11 99 or something like that and I thought it was a good deal but as soon as started  eating it it just didn't seem right. The wings were okay but I only ate a few of them because it didn't seem right. The cheese sticks very soft and not taste was bland. The pretzel sticks were great. Still hungry I got the desert brownies with ice cream. Meh is how i rank this dessert. The kiddo liked it but shes 6.  Overall I left there with a party of three and a tab of $60. Not bad. I also left with an upset stomach that has carried over into today.

They were having trouble heating an area, but still seating customers next to the freezing area. Meanwhile half the restaurant was empty. We needed to move just to warm up. Service was friendly but very slow. Just a lack luster experience. It will be awhile before returning or at least this location.

The last TGI Friday's I went to was up in Gurnee and the place was Awesome! Lots of people, fun atmosphere, great deals on apps, entertaining bartenders, juicy burgers. So that's what I was expecting when I came to this location.  Unfortunately I felt like I walked on set to an episode of The Walking Dead. The zombie bartender had been bit, she was extremely slow to order, coughing, and growling at us. Holy dead zone!  Food was just okay, nothing spectacular, but TGIO (Thank god it's over).  Won't be back.

We stopped in for some endless apps. The hostess was nice. We put in our drink order and food order.  I asked for lemon with my water, the lemons came after the water. A different server delivered our food. We asked for silverware and plates. We sat there watching our food get cold. We saw the server taking care of her tables and obviously had no intention of getting us plates and silverwear. We flagged down another server and asked for plates and silverwear. Heart  pushed the plate the lemons were on towards me and we waited more. We saw our own server and flagged her down. We asked for plates and silverwear. She walked away, the other server brought silverware, no plates. We wait. Our server returned with silverwear and no plates. We asked for them again. We wait. At this point, our food is cold. Our server brings plates. We eat cold food. We needed a few things so we spend a few minutes trying to flag someone down, we finally see our server and flag her down. We asked for drink refills, ranch for the remaining buffalo wings, napkins and second round of appetizers. We sat another 5 minutes trying to get service. We saw our server walk by 3 times. The table next to us had the same issues with the same server. At this point, the wings are too cold to eat, the ranch never came and I ask for a manager. We wait. The water came right before the manager did. Still no ranch. The manager apologized and said they've been busy all day. He took care of our bill. We left and won't return.

I came here tonight for a late dinner with my sister and it was horrible! My sister ordered a drink and we never got a straw we ordered our food around 1035 and didn't recieve it till almost 11:30 and it wasnt even hot! the service tonight was just terrible I didn't even bother to complain I was just ready to get out of there and forget the experience
Great place for after work deals. Service seems to always be great, and my friends (co-workers) and I love to visit.

The food is good but the service is glacially slow. I was have way through my meal before my daughter got her ores of mozzarella sticks. And the wait for the refill was even longer!  When they say endless apps they mean the wait to actually get them!!

Horrible service.  Sat down at 6:30 ordered chips and food.  Had to ask host about chips at 6:45, he said he would tell our server.  She stopped by and said they were making a new batch.  Got our burgers at 6:55 . Still no chips, tables around us got chips.  7:15 done  with burgers still no chips, Asked for our check at 7:17, server never mentioned us not getting chips apologized or anything, 7:26 saying my points code was not working took number again and went away. 7:30 we were able to walk out all done,  BUT NO chips for us!  :)

For the third weekend in a row My husband and I came here for dinner around 5 o'clock. Tester aunt was half empty & people waiting in the entrance way Today there was only one couple ahead of us & it was a 20 minute wait That wouldn't of been so bad if the tester aunt wasn't half empty. There was a whole section that literally had nobody in it We asked why so long & the hostess saiid "There was no service in that area"  How can a tester aunt make money if it is sitting half empty?

Terrible service and dirty. Tried to go here on a Sunday afternoon around 3:30pm. Walked into the bar, which wasn't very busy. Sat at a table that had 3 tables next to it that had dirty plates and glasses all over it. We sat there for over 10mins and not one person acknowledged us, several just walked by. Finally a little later we just decided to get up and leave. Only then did someone try to help us and we said bye and they didn't seem to care.

This is our first time here and our service has been the least bit satisfying. We were sat and it took the server 15 minutes to even acknowledge us. The girl he was training had to address our table and take our order & it was her first day!!  My boyfriend and I thought it was our servers first day & she was training him!!! To say the least our server Josh was horrible and it'll be awhile until we return. & I'll make sure he is not our server.

Come here all the time ,only when dawn is working! Great pour of drinks and she's hilarious. The boss Jenny is awesome and will help with any need . Servers are friendly ! Always bring my friends and family here !

Schaumburg , Illinois  Went to TGIF on Monday 22 May 17 to meet a god child for dinner.  Her young son accompanied her to dinner.  Friday's is a nice place to enjoy a casual dinner with friends or family.  The place is clean and the service efficient.  My god child ordered the sesame chicken while I had the Chicken & shrimp.  Oh , the kid ? He enjoyed the hamburger , what else would a kid order in a restaurant.  The food was good and the conversation enjoyable.  But I must comment on our server , the reason for this review.   This is not my first time dining at a Friday's.  This is my first time at this particular Friday's however.  Our server was Melissa.  She was very pleasant , always smiling , very polite and knew how to talk to customers.   I wish all wait staff were as polite as Melissa.  Why do I say that ?  Because there was a minor issue which she immediately addressed and resolved in a very professional manor.  She made us feel right at home. Kudos to Friday's for having such a polite , efficient employee on their staff.   **Free parking in the private lot, always a plus in my book.   The combination of good food , reasonable prices and polite wait staff give this place 4 stars.

I really don't recommend this restaurant if you are looking for a food burger and appetizer the quality isn't really good. It needs a huge upgrade for the place and the menu. You just don't have that much of options!
Visted here on a Sunday night, our server Jenny was lazy and not attentive to our table and the restaurant was not busy. This place needs immediate training.

Is it possible to put zero? Ashley was my bartender last time I was there, horrible. This time she went up to the bartender and then I had horrible service again. I called the manager and all she did was put in the order I waited 30 min to put in.... never again
The food was good but the highlight was our server Elevio. He had such a pleasant manner, great attitude and never forgot anything. He should be the manager/trainer. Breath if fresh air.

If I could I'd rate this location a 0. Poor customer service from walking in the door. As we walked in no one greeted us. The manager was standing at the stand with the hostess and another server, her back was turned to us the entire time. When we asked for a booth they denied us our choice of seating even though there were a few booths open. There was very little interaction and just poorly executed customer service. We left before we ordered. I'd rather give my money to someone who actually wants our business. No wonder this place was dead compared to all the other restaurants in the area.

FIY the price for endless wings change :(. Any how want to write about this restaurant I really love coming here very nice people working here. The waitress and waiters were working their b.....s off walking back and forth like little ants, cleaning bring food, taking orders I must say they were tired. I was after I eat this delicious burger that was so juicy and well done. What can I write I'm coming back to eat this delicious food. The end. Lol.

My husband and I decided to go there on a Monday evening after some shopping. We started by ordering pop. We got the impression the waitress was disappointed we did not order alcoholic beverages. I ordered a french dip sandwich. The sandwich came without the au jus. The au jus is what makes it a french dip! Unfortunately, the person who brought us our food gave it to us and left right away. This meant I had to flag down our waitress to tell her it was missing the au jus. The chef must have forgotten about to get prepare it, because it took awhile for the waitress to return. She quickly left after she gave it to me so we had to flag her down again because my husband wanted a refill on his pop. She never asked how things were and she never asked if we needed anything.  After the meal, I went to the washroom. The lock on the stall I went into would not lock. I could tell the person in the stall next too me had the same problem. The sink splashed water everywhere and I could not get the paper towel dispenser to work. A very disappointing experience.

Where, oh where have all the TGI Fridays gone? That's the song I wail at home in the San Francisco Bay Area. Count on good old Schaumburg, IL, to come through as always! One thing I love about this chain is how the menu gets jazzed up every so often. There is always something new that catches my eye. I enjoyed my Southern Fried Chicken sandwich and loved the Tennessee Whiskey Cake a la mode.  A fun and festive place for sure with decent food and delectable desserts.

We finally went back last week. Sadly I never got a reply from corporate. We went back and we saw the same server! And she looks super miserable there!! She was sweeping instead of waiting. And was sweeping hard and angrily. Why is she still employed at this Friday's!

The little girl that was our so called hostess was very rude. There was hardly anyone in the place. She asked if a half table half booth was ok. I asked very politely if we could just have a full booth. She got an attitude and tossed our menus on the table and walked away. I then asked her was there a problem and she gave me some story of people are asking to be seated there and they only have one waitress. I told her she should've explained that and we would've understood.  Rude Rude Rude.....

Customer service needs improvement. Second time I've been there. The first time I went was for advertised special dine-in only. So I had them serve me two meals I took one bite and had them package the rest. The second time the people working there didn't have a clue of the menu or what to do. I mean really I asked for chicken fingers and they said they didn't have any then I looked at the menu and realized it was chicken tenders. One consolation the food is good.

Love this place.  Best staff ever.  Really polite and attentive. They really took care of me and my family from start to finish. Id highly recommend it to a friend. Way better than the bloomingdale location.
Worse Friday's ever! I was told even if I purchased food for my kids I couldn't give them anything from my plate. I was also told I couldn't take any leftovers home. I'll never come here again.
I like TGI Fridays a lot. This location provides good service and it's very convenient. I absolutely love the menu and their appetizers. The drinks are very good as well.
Standing here at the bar. Ten minutes to get noticed, and another ten to get the drink we asked for. It isn't really that busy in here either. No wonder there places close down.
STAY AWAY.  Filthy restaurant, horrible old food, high prices, inept staff and management.  Complete waste of time.
Our sever was great, sign up for the rewards system and you can get free meals or coupons in the mail! Enjoyable place for a family dinner. Try the spinach flat bread.

I ordered the Memphis ribs and they were DELICIOUS!!! The sauce is AMAZING!!!!  The price was only 12.99 and it came with two sides. I recommend everyone checking out this deal and I'm recommending this Friday's.

This place is under managed and understaffed!! 7:00pm in the evening on a sat night and they have no tables open for parties of 5 or more.. place is empty and seating 2-3 or less... this is unacceptable for a buisness... The holiday's aren't even here yet and they are having problems... won't return to this restaurant.. Hostess was making up her own wait times for customers .. never seen this before... brutal..

The absolute worst customer service ever. Rude servers, filthy dirty restaurant, food is always terrible either undercooked or completely over cooked. So glad we have found a restaurant across the street (CPK) which is 100x better than Fridays.
This place blows... long wait on ordering. Long wait on food. Don't waste your time. Burger King has more class than this dump.. avoid like the plague

Dude...no. Just no. I'm posting this while sitting at our table. Worst service ever. We order drinks right when we sat down and didn't get them until we finished dinner. We just canceled them. Waitress never offered refills. If we would've asked we probably would've never gotten them,  now we've been waiting for the bill for 25 minutes. At what point is it appropriate to dine and ditch?

Can lightning strike twice?  See my 11/10/17 review for TGIF.   After six weeks, I gave them a 2nd change to get my 12/29/17 online order of three $12.99 full slab rib meals w/ two sides correct. Last time, I gave them one star since all three meals had only one side each.  This time, I gave two stars since only two of the three meals had only one side; thus a 33% improvement.   I checked my order prior to leaving the restaurant and TGI DID. I laid out all three trays on the lobby bench and to my surprise; one of the three orders was fully correct.  Roger the Mgr was quite helpful and got me the two lost and missing sides in a timely manner.  One other minor complaint, is that Maria the hostess was more focus on training a new hostess than helping a customer pick-up his online order.   Unsure if I should buy the (1.) ribs a la Carte to avoid any mistakes, (2.) give another chance so eventually the order will be correct or (3.) order on any other day but Friday.

This is the worst looking pasta I have ever ordered from TGI Friday's. I wasn't expecting a 5 star service from this place but at least get my to go order correct. Low and behold I order the Cajun chicken and shrimp pasta but there is no pasta. Do yourself a favor and don't ever go to this place.

Just ok. Went for lunch and only one waiter for the bar section, who also happened to be the bartender. Food was delivered in a timely manner. No issues with the food. Waiter never came back to check on us after food was dropped off. The restrooms had a sewage problem going on and had a terrible smell. The smell was so bad I held my bladder for the rest of the afternoon so that I could avoid going back in. The water they served also had a funny smell to it which I was attributing to their sewage issue. If it weren't for the restroom issue I would have given another star. They didn't know what was going on with the restrooms which was concerning because you could smell sewage from as soon as you went into the back hallway. I don't know if I would go back to this location...I would probably go across the street to California pizza kitchen.

The food was pretty good, but the service was incredibly slow. After being seated by the hostess, we were seriously not greeted or brought water for at least 20 minutes. I almost went up to the hostess to make sure she assigned a server to our table! It was very awkward. They had many servers working, so it really didn't make sense why the service the entire evening was so ridiculously slow. Luckily the food was good, and a very decent price. We had the ribs and 10oz sirloin, which were both very tasty.
